greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: An example of a d-perfect sequence: a(n) = A007317(n) mod 3.
comment: Odd bisection seems to be A006996. See also A039969. - _Antti Karttunen_, Aug 15 2017
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..6561

D. Kohel, S. Ling and C. Xing, Explicit Sequence Expansions, in Sequences and their Applications, C. Ding, T. Helleseth, and H. Niederreiter, eds., Proceedings of SETA'98 (Singapore, 1998), 308-317, 1999. DOI: 10.1007/978-1-4471-0551-0_23
formula: a(n) = A007317(n) mod 3. - _Christian G. Bower_, Jun 12 2005
program: A039972_as_a_vector(size)= { my(A=vector(size)); for(j=1, size, A[j]=1+sum(k=1, j-1, A[k]*A[j-k])); apply(n->(n%3),A); }; \\ After _Michael Somos_' May 23 2005 code for A007317 and _Christian G. Bower_'s formula for A039972.
results.author: _N. J. A. Sloane_.
ext: More terms from _Christian G. Bower_, Jun 12 2005
Formula added to the name by _Antti Karttunen_, Aug 15 2017
